text.section:
Except as otherwise provided in this section, a committee may not vote on a bill unless:
a fiscal note accompanies the bill; and
if the bill affects the funding of a State pension system, an actuarial analysis of the bill is attached to or summarized in the note or the analysis is waived.

section.section: If a bill affects the funding of a State pension system and the standing committee to which the bill is referred determines that the fiscal impact on the State warrants an actuarial analysis of the bill, the standing committee shall ask the Department of Legislative Services to obtain the actuarial analysis.
The standing committee may waive the actuarial analysis if the standing committee certifies that prompt action on the bill is needed to conduct legislative business.
The Executive Director of the Department of Legislative Services shall have that Department prepare a fiscal note for each bill.

If the chairman of the committee to which a bill is referred certifies that prompt committee action on the bill is needed to conduct legislative business and, before the Department prepares the fiscal note for the bill, holds a hearing on the bill, the Department shall prepare the note as soon after the hearing as possible.

When a standing committee asks for an actuarial analysis of a bill that affects a State pension system, the Department of Legislative Services shall:
obtain the analysis; and
summarize the analysis in the fiscal note or attach the analysis to the note.
The Department of Legislative Services shall send a copy of a fiscal note for a bill to the committee to which the bill is referred and to the primary sponsor of the bill.

text.section: Upon request of the Department of Legislative Services, a unit of State or local government promptly shall provide any information requested by the Department for preparing a fiscal note.

section.section:
A fiscal note for a bill shall contain an estimate of the fiscal impact of the bill on the revenues and expenditures of the State government and of local governments:
during the year in which the bill is to become effective and the next 4 years after that year; and
if the full fiscal impact of a bill is not expected to occur during those years, during each year until and the first year during which that impact is expected to occur.

If a bill, as introduced or amended, imposes a mandate on a local government unit, the fiscal note for the bill shall contain:
a statement that clearly identifies the imposition of the mandate; and
an estimate of the fiscal impact of the mandate and, if applicable and if data is available, the effect on local property tax rates.

If a bill, as introduced or amended, requires a mandated appropriation, the fiscal note for the bill shall contain:
a statement that clearly identifies the imposition of the mandated appropriation; and
an estimate of the fiscal impact of the mandated appropriation.
A fiscal note shall identify the sources of the information that the Department used in preparing the estimates of fiscal impact.

text.section:
As soon as possible after the adoption of an amendment that changes the fiscal impact of a bill, the Department of Legislative Services shall:
prepare a revised fiscal note for the bill; and
send the revised note:
to the chairman of the committee to which the bill is referred in the house of origin;
if the bill has reached the opposite house, to the chairman of the committee to which the bill is referred in that house;
if the bill is in the custody of either the Secretary of the Senate or the Chief Clerk of the House, to that officer; and
to the primary sponsor of the bill.

section.section: The Department of Legislative Services shall keep a copy of each fiscal note for 3 years after preparation of the note.
The copies shall be reasonably available for public inspection.

text.section: Fiscal notes need not be published in the Senate journal or House journal.

section.section: A bill may be introduced without a fiscal note accompanying the bill.
The validity of an enactment is not affected by the presence, absence, or content of the fiscal note.

In its summary report of legislation enacted by the General Assembly that has a fiscal impact, the Department of Legislative Services shall include a list of legislation that:
affects local government units; or
requires a mandated appropriation in the annual budget bill.
In the list of legislation described in subparagraph (i)1 of this paragraph, the Department of Legislative Services shall indicate which legislation imposes mandates on local government units.
